learning_outcomes.description: Identify and describe key principles underpinning the criminal law, particularly the concept of criminal responsibility.
Understand how the criminal law operates in relation to specific offences, defences, and contexts.
Analyse and critically evaluate the criminal law within specific situations, contexts, and crime types.
Apply effective legal research skills, such as analysis of case law, legislation, and secondary sources, to understand the application of the law and to support arguments re: law reform.
Demonstrate and apply skills required to communicate effectively within a legal and policy context.

assessments.task_description:
During the Week 5 Seminar (i.e. Thursday 26 March 2026), you will be expected to complete and submit Activity One. This Activity is designed to demonstrate your engagement with and understanding of content covered in weeks 1-4 of the course. To prepare for this Activity, you will be guided to engage with materials and discussions during the Week 1 - 4 seminars, and you may be prompted to conduct some additional research, activities, and/or readings on relevant topics throughout these weeks in order to complete the activity. A detailed task guide and marking criteria will be available in the Assessment folder on the course Blackboard site in Week 1.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. Guidance on this requirement will be provided in the task guide.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

learning_activities.topic:
Seminars

The seminar topics are:

  1. Criminal Law and Criminal Responsibility
  2. Understanding Offences
  3. Understanding Defences
  4. Extending Criminal Responsibility
  5. Reflecting on Criminal Responsibility - and completion of Activity One.
  6. Unlawful Killing
  7. Offences against the Person
  8. Sexual and Domestic Violence Offences
  9. Applying and Critiquing the Criminal Law - and completion of Activity Two
  10. Property Offences and Corporate/Institutional Crime
  11. Drug Offences and Public Order Offences
  12. Applying and Critiquing the Criminal Law - and completion of Activity Three
  13. Review of Course - Criminal Law in Context

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
